page.title: 18IBA/BBC TRANSMITTING STATION
page.content: IBA set up the first transmitter on the site in Church Hougham in 1959. In 1965 the BBC installed their trans_ mitter in a second building but used the same mast.The buildings contain the transmitters,cooling equipment, workshops and offices for the day to day running of the Mobile Maintenance Team which look after all the transmitters in the South_East. The mast is 373.5 metres above sea level and weighs about 91 tons.There are a number of smaller aerials attached to the mast which receive signals from other transmitters.It takes 45 minutes to climb the mast but the"Sky Climber", a cage for 2 men can be winched to the top in 5 minutes. The BBC programmes come from the T.V. centre to Church Hougham via Crystal Palace and Blue Bell Hill.
